CG Rustplot ( Project Link )

A terminal-based plotting library for Rust. Here's an animation of a function plot of a square wave fourier series with different chaning phases:

It has many different plot types, including scatterplot, regionplot, densityplot, etc. Check out the README on GitHub for a full list with examples. For example, here is a binned array plot which shows a function similar to f(x, y) = sin(x * y):

One of the other cool features is that the function plot automatically determines an "interesting" domain to plot it over. It will find points of interest on the function by using numerical techniques, and will try to fit a plot to match them. For example, here is the plot of a polynomial without having to input anything except the function itself:

It was originally written because I didn't find any good alternatives that were super simple and easy to use. I was doing mathematical optimization using rust, so I just wanted a fast, easy plotting library to see the current progress. It now has over 800 downloads on crates.io and is being updated with new features every release.
